wikipedia_page.main: The Hon. Ashley George John Ponsonby  (24 June 1831 – 12 January 1898) was a British Liberal politician.

response: The Hon. Ashley Ponsonby, younger son of the first Baron, was a Liberal politician. Another member of this branch of the Ponsonby family was the Conservative politician Sir Charles Ponsonby, 1st Baronet. He was the son of the Hon. Edwin Charles William Ponsonby, fifth son of the second Baron de Mauley.
*Ashley Ponsonby DL, JP (1831–1898), British Liberal politician

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: The hospital has its origins in a Victorian country residence known as “Heatherfield” built in 1876, possibly for the Farrar family (whose motto 'Ferre va Ferme' appears over the front door). It was in the ownership of the Ponsonby family between 1881 and 1891, when the Hon. Ashley Ponsonby, a Justice of the Peace and cousin of Sir Henry Ponsonby, Equerry to Queen Victoria, and his family had their country seat there.
